judges: Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
We have considered all of appellant’s contentions— including the alleged variance between the allegata and probata — in the light of the 207 page Record and the authorities cited by each party, and find no merit in any of his contentions.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Vincent M. Casey, with him Margiotti & Casey, for appellant.
casebody.head_matter:
Wechsler v. Minnotte, Appellant.
Argued October 2, 1964.
Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
reargument refused January 12, 1965.
Vincent M. Casey, with him Margiotti & Casey, for appellant.
November 24, 1964:
Leonard Boreman, for appellee.
